Package com.iv1201.project.recruitment.presentation

Class ApplicationController

java.lang.Object
com.iv1201.project.recruitment.presentation.ApplicationController
@Controller
@Scope("session")
public class ApplicationController
extends java.lang.Object
ApplicationController is the controller for when an applicant makes an application. All mappings return the same view but modify it with model attributes.

  • Method Details

    • startApplication

      @GetMapping("/apply") public java.lang.String startApplication​(java.util.Locale locale, @ModelAttribute("competenceFormObject") CompetenceForm competenceFormObject, java.security.Principal principal, org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      startApplication is the starting point of an application.
      Parameters:
      locale - the user's locale which determines the translation table in the database
      competenceFormObject - the object that fetches the competenceForm
      principal - the logged in user
      model - for thymeleaf
      Returns:
      applicationView with competence form

    • showCompetenceForm

      @GetMapping("/apply/competences") public java.lang.String showCompetenceForm​(@ModelAttribute("competenceFormObject") CompetenceForm competenceFormObject, org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      Mapping to deliver the competence form for the first time.
      Parameters:
      competenceFormObject - the form to be filled out
      model - for thymeleaf
      Returns:
      applicationView with competence form

    • fetchCompetenceForm

      @PostMapping("/apply/competence") public java.lang.String fetchCompetenceForm​(@Valid @ModelAttribute("competenceFormObject") @Valid CompetenceForm competenceFormObject, org.springframework.validation.BindingResult bindingResult, org.springframework.ui.Model model)
      Mapping to fetch the competence form.
      Parameters:
      competenceFormObject - the filled out form from thymeleaf
      bindingResult - validation of the form
      model - for thymeleaf
      Returns:
      applicationView with competence form
